page.title: 08BROOK BAY
page.content: Brook Bay stretches from{Sedmore {Point}to{Hanover Point}along the south coast of the Island.It is the oldest bay on the Isle of Wight.At Sedmore Point the{sandstone bed}overlies a layer of{mottled clays}making a cliff that is prone to weathering.Between Sedmore Point and Brook Chine the strata have slipped,forming an undercliff,known as"Roughland",along the whole length of which there is no clear exsposure of rock.The cliff declines down to the beach due to erosion from the sea.In the south-west the cliff slopes 20 yards to the beach.In the cliffs of Brook Bay the remains of various large reptiles, including Iguanodon bernissartensis and Hoplosaurus hulkei have been found.
